list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His room is always very untidy

list_ex_of_english: Indeed, the edition as a whole is too untidy to be regarded as satisfactory.
These modifications to their pure theory may seem to be untidy and arbitrary.
We try to fool the past by reconstructing it in our own image, imposing order and significance on the untidy sources we depend upon.
This will lead to untidy and unwanted administration and temptations.
They are far more untidy, for instance, than the average businessman going on holiday with a caravan.
The command arrangements too, should our forces be committed to fight, still seem to me to be untidy.
The overall layout of the book is at times unhelpful: tables and diagrams spill into margins and generally look cramped and untidy.
To talk as if, somehow, all that is happening is very untidy, and must be put in order, is, to many of us, monstrous.
